scam_types.description: Fraudsters trick users into sending money via UPI or sharing UPI PIN/OTP
example_messages: Hello sir, I am from Paytm customer care. Your KYC is pending. Please complete verification by sending Rs.1 to this UPI: verify.paytm@paytm and share the 12-digit reference number
Congratulations! You have won Rs.50,000 in PhonePe lucky draw. To claim, send Rs.99 registration fee to winner2024@okaxis
Your bank account will be blocked in 2 hours. Verify immediately by sending Rs.1 to rbi.verify@ybl
Hi, I want to buy your product. I'll pay extra Rs.500. Please accept my payment request on Google Pay and confirm
Sir your Aadhaar is linked to 23 bank accounts. Suspicious activity detected. Send Rs.10 to cyberpolice@paytm to file complaint
Amazon refund of Rs.8,999 is pending. To process, please send us screenshot after accepting our UPI collect request
Your electricity will be disconnected today. Pay immediately to mseb.urgent@okicici or call 8080808080
I am buying your item. Please enter this UPI PIN to confirm the payment: Just enter your UPI PIN one time
Testing payment gateway. Send Re.1 to test@axis verification account. Money will be refunded with Rs.5000 instantly
Your phone number won bumper prize of Rs.25 lakh. Pay processing fee Rs.2500 to lottery.india@paytm to claim prize money
intent_signals: payment reversal tricks (asking victim to send money first)

whitelist_patterns: actual customer support conversations with ticket IDs
context_checks: verify if user initiated the transaction
check for established business relationship
validate against known legitimate merchant database

scam_types.description: Scammers trick users into sharing OTP codes for unauthorized access
example_messages: Hello, this is HDFC Bank. Your account shows suspicious activity. Please share the OTP we just sent to verify your identity
You have received refund of Rs.6,500. To credit money to your account, share the 6-digit code we sent you
Your Aadhaar card will expire today. Urgent update needed. Tell us the OTP to complete e-KYC verification process
Sir, your credit card EMI payment failed. Share OTP immediately to avoid late charges and CIBIL score impact
This is Flipkart customer care. Your order is cancelled. For instant refund share OTP that came on your phone
Congratulations! You won iPhone 15. Customs clearance requires OTP verification. Tell me the code to release your prize
We are from SBI fraud department. Your card is being used in USA. To block transaction, tell us OTP immediately
Your Netflix subscription will expire. We sent verification code. Read it to me to continue your premium membership
Confirm your Aadhaar-PAN linking by sharing the 6-digit security code. Deadline is today or Rs.10000 penalty
Sir I am calling from Amazon. Your account hacked. Share OTP quickly so I can secure your account right now
intent_signals: fake fraud alert to get OTP

context_checks: never legitimate to ask user to share OTP verbally
real banks/services never ask for OTP via call/message
OTP is for user's eyes only - any sharing request is scam

scam_types.description: Fake delivery/courier scams involving payment for COD, customs, or redelivery

Your Amazon package delivery failed. Reattempt charges Rs.150. Pay here: tinyurl.com/amzn-redeliver urgent
DHL courier notice: Your shipment from USA held at Mumbai customs. Pay duty Rs.4,999: dhl-india-customs.com/pay
Hello mam, I am delivery boy outside your house with parcel. COD Rs.799 but I have no change. Pay to 9876543210 UPI
IndiaPost registered parcel for you. Unclaimed since 3 days. Storage charges Rs.299. Pay immediately: indiapost-track.online
Your iPhone 14 order ready for delivery. Address verification fee Rs.99 pending. Confirm: apple-delivery-in.com
Urgent: Your parcel returned to warehouse. Re-delivery fee Rs.180. Pay now or package will be destroyed: bit.ly/deliver
DHL tracking update: International courier needs sign. Download label: dhl-shipping-india.net/pdf-3847291.apk
Mam your Flipkart order address is incomplete. Update + pay Rs.50 handling charge or order cancelled: flpkrt.co/update
intent_signals: COD payment pressure via online mode
APK file disguised as delivery label
psychological_triggers: small payment amount (Rs.50-500) to build trust

whitelist_patterns: legitimate courier tracking from official domains
actual COD delivery with physical presence
context_checks: verify domain authenticity (.com vs .co, .xyz, .online)
real couriers never ask for payment via UPI/links
customs fees for international packages go through official channels
APK files are never legitimate delivery documents

context_checks: no legitimate investment offers guaranteed returns
daily returns of 5-20% are mathematically impossible to sustain
celebrity endorsements are usually fake
pressure to invest immediately is red flag
testimonial-heavy content without substance

intent_signals: advance fee requirement before loan disbursal
courier charges for credit card delivery
psychological_triggers: small upfront fee for large loan amount

context_checks: real loans never require upfront fees before approval
0% interest is red flag (except specific EMI conversions)
instant approval without documents is impossible
credit score improvement takes time, no instant fixes
verify website domains carefully

context_checks: government never demands immediate payment via phone/message
real legal notices come through registered post
police don't ask for money over phone

government departments don't use UPI/third-party payment links

psychological_triggers: fear of loss (account suspended, money stolen)
trust in brand (Amazon, HDFC, Netflix, etc.)

whitelist_patterns: official customer support initiated by user
context_checks: real support never asks for OTP, CVV, PIN
verify sender/caller authenticity
check URL domains carefully (typo domains)
support teams don't send payment links via SMS/WhatsApp
user should always contact support via official channels

context_checks: never send money to someone you haven't met
romance + money request is major red flag
verify identity through video calls (not photos)
overseas emergency stories are common scam tactics
real relationships don't start with money requests

context_checks: always verify through independent contact with family member
call back on known number, don't use provided number
family members don't demand instant money transfers
verify hospital/police station claims independently
new number + emergency = major red flag
take time to verify despite urgency claims

Your refund of Rs.3,500 approved but our system needs verification. Accept collect request on your UPI app to receive money back
intent_signals: reverse scam (claiming victim received wrong money)
legal threats if money not returned

whitelist_patterns: legitimate refund notifications from verified sources
refunds processed automatically without user action
context_checks: refunds never require OTP sharing
remote access apps = scam in refund context
companies don't send APK files for refunds
UPI collect requests for refund is backwards (should be payment)
mistaken credit claims are social engineering
real refunds happen automatically, no user action needed

scam_types.description: Scammers trick users into scanning QR codes that initiate payments instead of receiving money
example_messages: Sir I am buyer for your OLX item. I will pay Rs.15,000. Scan this QR code to receive money. [Sends payment QR instead of receive QR]
Great! I'll buy your furniture. To confirm you're genuine seller scan my verification QR. This will show I sent Rs.8,000 [Actually debit QR]
Hello, I want to purchase. I'm sending Rs.12,000. Please scan this QR to accept payment. Money will come in 5 minutes [Sends payment QR]
I'm interested in your product. For online payment security, scan this QR to activate receiving mode on Google Pay [Tricks into paying]
Hi, buying your laptop. Sent Rs.25,000. Scan QR to confirm receipt. If money not received after scan, I'll resend [Makes victim pay instead]
Payment gateway verification needed. Scan this QR code to enable receiving payment from me. This is Paytm security feature [Payment QR disguised]
I'll pay extra Rs.1,000 for urgent delivery. Just scan my QR for instant payment. Show me screenshot after scanning [Makes victim pay]
Your item interested. Payment by UPI. Scan QR in this image to get Rs.10,000 in your account within 30 seconds [Reverse payment trick]
Amazon buyer here. Scan this QR to verify your seller account for payment of Rs.6,500. This is buyer protection code [Payment QR trap]
Sir one minute. My PhonePe not working. You have Google Pay? Scan this code to receive my payment Rs.4,999 [Sends debit QR instead]
intent_signals: asking to scan QR to receive money (reversal trick)
buyer/seller context with QR scan request
technical jargon to confuse (activate receiving mode)

whitelist_patterns: legitimate merchant QR codes for receiving payments
context_checks: receiving money = share YOUR QR, not scan theirs
paying money = scan THEIR QR
buyer never sends QR to seller for payment
seller sends QR to buyer for payment
verify QR direction before scanning
genuine buyers use payment apps directly, not verification QRs

whitelist_patterns: well-known legitimate short URLs in proper context
context_checks: verify domain spelling carefully
check for HTTPS and padlock
hover over links to see actual URL
legitimate services use official domains
banks never send login links via message
government sites always end in .gov.in

scam_types.description: AI-generated voice clones impersonating family, friends, or officials (2024-2026 emerging threat)
example_messages: [Voice call] Hi Mom, it's me Rahul. I'm in serious trouble. Met with accident. Phone broken, calling from hospital. Need Rs.2 lakh urgently for surgery. Send to doctor's account I'll share via SMS [AI voice clone]

[Voice call] Sir, this is your manager Rajesh Kumar speaking. I need you to do urgent wire transfer of Rs.5 lakh to client account. I'm in meeting, can't access laptop. I'll send details on WhatsApp [Boss voice deepfake]
[Voice call] Papa, it's me. I'm kidnapped. Please don't call police. They want Rs.10 lakh ransom. I'll send bank details. Please save me papa [Real voice emotional context]
I just received voice message from CEO asking to transfer Rs.25 lakh to new vendor. Voice sounds exactly like him but email ID slightly different. Should I proceed?

[Voice call] This is Sub Inspector Sharma from Andheri police station. Your son arrested in drug case. You recognize my voice - we met last year at your colony event. Need Rs.3 lakh bail urgently [Trusted voice impersonation]

[Suspicious context] Friend called saying he's stuck abroad urgently needs Rs.50,000. Voice was identical but he was speaking very fast and call disconnected in 2 minutes. Sent bank details via message.
[Video call - poor quality] Hi Aunty, this is Priya. Network very poor here. Can you see me? I need urgent money Rs.1.5 lakh. Medical emergency. [Deepfake video + voice]
Received WhatsApp voice note from my daughter's number. Sounds 95% like her but something feels off. Says she's in trouble and needs money sent to someone immediately.

[Voice call] Hey dude, remember me? Your college friend Amit. I'm in Bangalore for work. Met with emergency. My wallet stolen. Can you send Rs.8,000? Will return next week. [Voice cloned from social media]
Got call from 'bank manager' who knew my name, account number and even spoke in familiar voice similar to my regular branch manager. Asked for OTP for 'account security upgrade'.
intent_signals: poor call quality excuse (to hide imperfection)
inability to verify through alternative channels
voice cloned from social media/public content

whitelist_patterns: verified video calls showing clear face and voice sync
context_checks: ALWAYS verify through alternative channel (new call to known number)
ask personal questions only real person would know
be suspicious of urgency + money request
poor call quality = red flag in important requests
verify boss/authority requests through official channels
family emergencies should be verified with other family members
social media voice samples can be used for deepfakes

scam_types.description: Phishing links mimicking KYC verification for banks, wallets, and services (2025-2026 rising threat)

scam_types.description: Automated bots for mass SMS/WhatsApp/social media scam distribution (2024-2026 emerging)
example_messages: [Bulk message pattern] Hello dear! You are selected for work from home opportunity. Earn Rs.25,000 monthly. Register: jobsindia2026.com Ref code: WFH45821 [Sent to thousands]
[Sequential spam] Message 1: Hi! Message 2: Interested in part-time job? Message 3: Data entry work Message 4: Earn Rs.500 daily Message 5: Join here: bit.ly/job9876 [Bot sequence]
[Generic template] CONGRATULATIONS! Your mobile number won Rs.50,000 in lucky draw organized by [COMPANY_NAME]. Claim at: [WINNER_LINK] Code: [RANDOM_NUMBER] [Variable insertion]
[Rapid response] Your reply detected in 0.3 seconds. Too fast for human. Bot sends: Great! Send Rs.1,000 registration fee to: [UPI_ID] immediately to confirm your slot!
[Copy-paste error] Hello [NAME], greetings from [COMPANY]! We have exciting opportunity for you [ERROR: Variable not loaded]. Visit: scam-site.com [Template glitch visible]

[Mass friend requests] 50+ friend requests in 1 hour from new profiles. All sending same message: Hi dear, I'm forex trader. I can teach you. Minimum investment Rs.10,000. 200% return guaranteed [Bot network]

[Identical messages] 10 different numbers sending exact same text: Your parcel stuck at post office. Pay Rs.150 redelivery charge: indiapost-track-2026.online Delivery ID: [RANDOM] [Coordinated bot attack]

[Auto-reply pattern] You: What is this about? Bot: Explained in website link dear You: How much? Bot: Full details in registration portal You: Who are you? Bot: Visit website for info [Pre-programmed responses]
[WhatsApp blast] Received message from unknown international number +234-XXX: Hello friend! Business proposal. Invest $500, earn $5,000. WhatsApp: +234-XXX-XXXX now! [Automated international scam]
[Suspicious timing] Received 5 messages at exactly 3:00 AM, 3:05 AM, 3:10 AM, 3:15 AM, 3:20 AM - all different scams but consistent 5-min intervals [Scheduled bot activity]

whitelist_patterns: legitimate bulk notifications (bank alerts, OTPs, order confirmations)
known promotional messages from verified businesses
automated customer service chatbots with clear identity
context_checks: check for template errors/placeholders
verify sender legitimacy through official channels
suspicious if multiple messages with same content/timing
real businesses have proper sender IDs
generic openers + money talk = red flag
instant replies to complex questions indicate bot
international numbers for India-specific offers are suspicious

multi_layer_analysis.layer_1: Keyword and regex pattern matching for immediate flagging
multi_layer_analysis.layer_2: Intent and context analysis using AI semantic understanding
multi_layer_analysis.layer_3: Risk scoring based on psychological triggers and behavioral patterns
multi_layer_analysis.layer_4: Conversation flow analysis for evolving scam tactics
multi_layer_analysis.layer_5: Entity extraction (phone, UPI, links) for intelligence gathering

false_positive_mitigation.contextual_analysis: Check conversation history for established relationships
false_positive_mitigation.whitelist_verification: Compare against known legitimate entity patterns
false_positive_mitigation.multi_signal_requirement: Require multiple indicators before high-confidence flagging
false_positive_mitigation.temporal_analysis: Consider timing and sequence of messages

strategy_1_new_scam_detection.description: Automatically identify and learn from new scam patterns
approach: Monitor flagged conversations for novel techniques not matching existing patterns
Cluster similar low-confidence detections to find emerging patterns
Extract common features from user-reported scams
Identify temporal spikes in specific message patterns
Cross-reference with global scam databases and threat intelligence feeds
strategy_1_new_scam_detection.implementation: Use unsupervised learning to detect anomalies in scam tactics, then have security analysts validate and add to library

strategy_2_adaptive_weights.description: Dynamically adjust confidence weights based on effectiveness
approach: Track false positive and false negative rates per scam type
Adjust regex patterns threshold based on precision/recall metrics
Retrain AI model monthly with new validated samples
A/B test rule variations and keep best performers
Reduce weight of overmatching patterns, increase weight of precise ones
strategy_2_adaptive_weights.implementation: Feedback loop where security team marks true/false positives, system auto-adjusts weights to optimize F1 score

strategy_3_regional_adaptation.description: Learn region-specific and language-specific scam variations
approach: Maintain separate pattern libraries for different regions (North India, South India, tier-1 cities, rural areas)
Track language-specific keywords (Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Bengali romanized text)
Learn local brand names and regional financial products
Adapt to regional festivals and seasonal scams (Diwali, tax season)
Monitor regional news for context (local scams, regulatory changes)
strategy_3_regional_adaptation.implementation: Geo-tagging detection rules and maintaining regional variant databases with automatic pattern propagation

approach: Implement graduated response (flag, warn, block) based on confidence
Maintain user reputation scores (new users vs established)
Whitelist verified businesses and official entities
Allow user appeals and feedback for false positives
Context-aware detection (family conversations vs stranger interactions)
Time decay for indicators (urgent keywords less suspicious in established conversations)
strategy_4_avoid_overblocking.implementation: Multi-tier alert system with human review for borderline cases, ML model trained on feedback to improve precision

strategy_5_threat_intelligence_integrati.description: Integrate external threat feeds and reported scam data
approach: Pull data from cybercrime portals (cybercrime.gov.in)
Integrate RBI, TRAI, and banking sector alerts
Monitor social media for trending scam reports
Collaborate with banks for real-time fraud phone/UPI numbers
Subscribe to global scam databases (FTC, Action Fraud, etc.)
strategy_5_threat_intelligence_integrati.implementation: Daily sync with external APIs, blacklist updates, pattern library enrichment from verified sources

strategy_6_adversarial_learning.description: Prepare for scammers adapting to detection
approach: Simulate scam message variations (spelling changes, emoji insertions, space manipulation)
Train on obfuscation techniques (1 instead of I, @ instead of a)
Detect semantic intent even with different wording
Monitor for unusual character encodings and Unicode tricks
Red team exercises where security team creates new scam variants
strategy_6_adversarial_learning.implementation: Adversarial training where AI model is exposed to intentionally modified scam messages to generalization

deployment_recommendations.real_time_processing: Use edge computing for low-latency detection (<100ms response time)
deployment_recommendations.scalability: Containerized microservices architecture to handle millions of messages daily
deployment_recommendations.privacy: On-device pattern matching first, only send to cloud for AI analysis when confidence threshold met
deployment_recommendations.audit_trail: Log all detections with conversation context for regulatory compliance and forensics
deployment_recommendations.user_transparency: Provide explanations for why message was flagged (e.g., 'Contains urgency + payment request + unknown UPI ID')
deployment_recommendations.integration_points: SMS gateway, WhatsApp Business API, banking apps, payment wallets, telecom operators
deployment_recommendations.human_in_loop: Escalate 10-20% of borderline cases to human analysts for verification and learning
